summary: The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions on Somalia, notes exceptional circumstances in New York City due to Hurricane Sandy and recognizes the need for a short extension of the African Union Mission to Somalia's (AMISOM) mandate. The situation in Somalia continues to threaten international peace and security. Acting under Chapter VII, the Council authorizes Member States of the African Union to maintain AMISOM's deployment until 7 November 2012, to carry out its existing mandate as set out in resolutions 1772 (2007) and 2036 (2012).
